info.title: Classes
info.description: Classes Resource of the University API

get.description:
NOTE: WSO2 is finicky -- If you want to use query parameters, you need to explicitly use /? instead of just ? on this endpoint

Returns a collection of classes

parameters.name: field_sets
parameters.description: The field sets to return for each class (Ex: 'basic,assigned_instructors')

parameters.name: contexts
parameters.description: The contexts to return for each class (Ex: 'class_schedule')
For paging the collection (Ex: '0')
parameters.name: subset_start_offset

parameters.description: For paging the collection (Ex: '10')
parameters.name: subset_size

parameters.description: Comma-separated Enrollment Periods (Ex: 'Fall2018'), optionally including 'registration' or 'current' as well
parameters.name: enrollment_periods
term_code
parameters.description: The term code of the classes (formerly known as block code) (Ex: 'S')

parameters.name: teaching_area
parameters.description: The teaching area of the classes (Ex: 'DANCE' or 'C%20S')

parameters.name: course_number
parameters.description: The course number of the classes (Ex: '110' or '201R')

parameters.name: course_level
parameters.description: The course level of the classes (Ex: '4' for 400-level classes)

parameters.name: class_provider
parameters.description: The class provider of the classes, formerly known as section type (Ex: 'EVENING')

parameters.name: credit_hours
parameters.description: The credit hours of the classes (Ex: '3')

parameters.name: building
parameters.description: The building where the classes will be offered (Ex: 'TNRB')

parameters.name: room
parameters.description: The room number where the classes will be offered (Ex: '114')

parameters.name: days
parameters.description: The days of the week when the classes will be offered (Ex: 'MWF' or 'TTh')

parameters.name: start_time
parameters.description: Class start time must be at or after the given time, with a leading zero (Ex: '00:59', '07:50', or '23:59')

parameters.name: end_time
parameters.description: Class end time must be at or before the given time, with a leading zero (Ex: '00:59', '07:50', or '23:59')

parameters.name: instructor_id
parameters.description: The assigned instructor's BYU ID

parameters.name: attribute
parameters.description: The name, type, and value of an attribute (Ex: 'name,type,value')

200.description: A collection of Classes successfully returned

schema.description: The entire request behaves as a single transaction -- either all changes are made, or it fails and none are made. If a property is provided, we will make that subresource look like the data provided. If there are already 3 instructors, but you pass in an array of 2, we will make the class have just those 2 instructors. If you pass in an empty array, we'll assume that means to get rid of all instructors. If you don't include an assigned_instructors property, we won't touch the existing instructors.

linked_classes.description: On an update, we only allow modifying a chosen class's linked classes with a link_relation of 'Parent' -- This will modify the linked class's associated 'Child' relationships accordingly. Also note that, currently, classes can only have one 'Parent'.

parameters.description: Values required to modify a class

schema.description: The entire request behaves as a single transaction -- either all changes are made, or it fails and none are made. If a property is provided, we will make that subresource look like the data provided. If there are already 3 instructors, but you pass in an array of 2, we will make the class have just those 2 instructors. If you pass in an empty array, we'll assume that means to get rid of all instructors. If you don't include an assigned_instructors property, we won't touch the existing instructors.

basic.description: This is required if the class does not already exist

linked_classes.description: On an update, we only allow modifying a chosen class's linked classes with a link_relation of 'Parent' -- This will modify the linked class's associated 'Child' relationships accordingly. Also note that, currently, classes can only have one 'Parent'.
